## Distribution of `how_high` & `craving` scores

```{r}
# Finding distribution of responses of how high for start/end survey
ggplot(data=uniq_integ, aes(x=how_high)) + geom_bar(stat="count") +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks=0:10) +
  labs(title = "Distribution of `how_high` Scores", x ="How High", y = "Count")
```

```{r}
# Finding distribution of responses of craving for start/timed survey
ggplot(data=uniq_integ, aes(x=craving)) + geom_bar(stat="count") +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks=0:10) +
  labs(title = "Distribution of `craving` Scores", x ="Craving", y = "Count")
```

```{r}
# Finding distribution of responses of how_high for start survey
ggplot(data=subset(uniq_integ, survey_type == "start"),
       aes(x=how_high)) + geom_bar(stat="count") +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks=0:10) +
  labs(title = "Distribution of `how_high` Scores for Start Survey Only",
       x ="How High", y = "Count")
```

```{r}
# Finding distribution of responses of how_high for start survey
ggplot(data=subset(uniq_integ, survey_type == "end"),
       aes(x=how_high)) + geom_bar(stat="count") +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks=0:10) +
  labs(title = "Distribution of `how_high` Scores for End Survey Only",
       x ="How High", y = "Count")
```

```{r}
# Finding distribution of responses of how_high for start survey
time_conv = strftime(bind_rows(start, end)$timestamp, format="%H:%M:%S")
time = as.POSIXct(time_conv, format="%H:%M:%S")
time = hour(time)

ggplot(data=bind_rows(start, end),
       aes(x=time)) +
  geom_bar(stat="count", width = 0.9, position = position_nudge(x = 0.5)) +
  labs(title = "Distribution of Smoking Session Throughout the Day",
       x ="Hour in Day", y = "Count") +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks=0:23)
```

```{r}
# Finding distribution of responses of how_high for start survey
time_conv = strftime(subset(uniq_integ, !is.na(id))$timestamp, format="%H:%M:%S")
time = as.POSIXct(time_conv, format="%H:%M:%S")
time = hour(time)

ggplot(data=subset(uniq_integ, !is.na(id)), aes(x=time)) +
  geom_bar(stat="count", width = 0.9, position = position_nudge(x = 0.5)) +
  labs(title = "Distribution of MUSE Task Completion Throughout the Day",
       x ="Hour in Day", y = "Count") +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks=0:23)
```

## Finding relationship between cognitive scores & `how_high`

### Stroop

```{r}
# Finding relationship between S_num_cor and how_high
ggplot(data=uniq_integ, aes(x=how_high, y=S_num_cor, color=epoch)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = 'lm', size=0.5, se = FALSE) +
  labs(x ="How High", y = "Stroop Number Correct") +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks=0:10)

summary(lm(S_num_cor ~ how_high, uniq_integ))
anova(lm(S_num_cor ~ how_high, uniq_integ))

summary(lm(S_num_cor ~ how_high, subset(uniq_integ, epoch="morning")))
anova(lm(S_num_cor ~ how_high, subset(uniq_integ, epoch="morning")))

summary(lm(S_num_cor ~ how_high, subset(uniq_integ, epoch="afternoon")))
anova(lm(S_num_cor ~ how_high, subset(uniq_integ, epoch="afternoon")))

summary(lm(S_num_cor ~ how_high, subset(uniq_integ, epoch="evening")))
anova(lm(S_num_cor ~ how_high, subset(uniq_integ, epoch="evening")))

summary(lm(S_num_cor ~ how_high, subset(uniq_integ, epoch="night")))
anova(lm(S_num_cor ~ how_high, subset(uniq_integ, epoch="night")))
```

### Stroop

## Distribution of `high` throughout the day

```{r}
time_conv = strftime(bind_rows(start, end)$timestamp, format="%H:%M:%S")
time = as.POSIXct(time_conv, format="%H:%M:%S")

ggplot(bind_rows(start, end),
       aes(x=time, y=how_high, color=survey_type)) +
  geom_point(na.rm = TRUE, size = 1.5, alpha = 0.3) +
  labs(title = "Distribution of High Throughout the Day (Total)",
       x = "Time of Day", y = "How High") +
  scale_x_datetime(date_breaks = "1 hour",
                   labels = time_format("%H:%M", tz = "America/New_York"),
                   expand = c(0,0)) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, vjust = 1.0, hjust = 1.0)) +
  scale_y_continuous(limits=c(0,10), breaks=seq(0,10, by = 1))
```

```{r}
for (i in 1:length(unique(uniq_integ$device_id))) {
  time_conv1 = strftime(subset(bind_rows(start, end), device_id ==
              unique(uniq_integ$device_id)[i])$timestamp, format="%H:%M:%S")
  time1 = as.POSIXct(time_conv1, format="%H:%M:%S")
  
  print(ggplot(subset(bind_rows(start, end),
                      device_id == unique(uniq_integ$device_id)[i]),
         aes(x=time1, y=how_high, color=survey_type)) +
          geom_point(na.rm = TRUE, size = 1.5, alpha = 0.7) +
    labs(title = paste("Distribution of High Throughout the Day (",
                       unique(uniq_integ$device_id)[i], ")"),
         x = "Time of Day", y = "How High") +
    scale_x_datetime(date_breaks = "1 hour",
                     labels = time_format("%H:%M", tz = "America/New_York")) +
    theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, vjust = 1.0, hjust = 1.0)) +
    scale_y_continuous(limits=c(0,10), breaks=seq(0,10, by = 1)))
}
```
